content:
It's great to hear that your morning yoga class has been having a positive impact on your productivity and motivation!

Incorporating more protein into your breakfast can definitely help you stay full until lunchtime. Protein takes longer to digest than carbohydrates, which means it can provide a more sustained energy release throughout the morning. This can help you feel more focused and productive, and reduce the likelihood of an energy crash or hunger pangs before lunch.

Additionally, protein can also help support muscle recovery and growth, which is especially important if you're incorporating physical activity into your daily routine, like your lunchtime workouts or walks.

Here are some high-protein breakfast ideas that you might find helpful:

* Eggs (6-7 grams of protein per egg)
* Greek yogurt with nuts or seeds (20-25 grams of protein per 6-ounce serving)
* Cottage cheese with fresh fruits (28-30 grams of protein per cup)
* Avocado toast with poached eggs (14-16 grams of protein per serving)
* Protein smoothie with Greek yogurt, milk, or protein powder (20-30 grams of protein per serving)

Remember to choose whole, unprocessed foods whenever possible, and adjust the portion sizes based on your individual protein needs.

It's also important to note that while protein can help with satiety and energy, it's also important to balance your breakfast with complex carbohydrates and healthy fats to ensure you're getting a well-rounded nutrient profile.

I hope this helps, and I'm excited to hear about your progress!
